name: South Hancock

trails_config.name: Hancock Loop Trail
trails_config.description: A flat Approach followed by an extremely steep loop that tags both Hancock peaks. Offers a classic 'remote' feel within the national forest.
trails_config.parking_info: Hancock Overlook Parking, Kancamagus Hwy, Lincoln, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, South Hancock rises to 4319 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4319 feet, South Hancock is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Hancock Loop Trail**, a **9.8 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
